titles.title: District of Columbia Justice Reform Act of 1993
District of Columbia Justice Reform Act of 1994
District of Columbia Justice Reform Act of 1994
District of Columbia Justice Reform Act of 1994

To amend title 11, District of Columbia Code, to increase the maximum amount in controversy permitted for cases under the jurisdiction of the Small Claims and Conciliation Branch of the Superior Court of the District of Columbia.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on District of Columbia.

committee.name: House Committee on District of Columbia

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on District of Columbia

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on District of Columbia. H. Rept. 103-174.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 98.

action.text: Mr. Stark moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: House Committee on District of Columbia

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Glenn with an amendment. With written report No. 103-261.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 429.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Ms. Norton asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/25/1994--Passed Senate amended. District of Columbia Justice Reform Act of 1994 - Amends the District of Columbia Code to increase to $5,000 (currently $2,000) the maximum amount in controversy permitted for cases under the jurisdiction of the Small Claims and Conciliation Branch of the Superior Court of the District of Columbia.
